Topic.Title: I beg of your help: My job is on the line

Posts.EditableText:
I promised my boss a working copy of a project which was 100% made on the demo version of QDK, which is only 8 days old. It was going great until today, when, trying to open my project, it gave me an error message: Run-Time Error '5': Invalid Procedeur Call or Argument. After that it exits the program. I've tried restarting. I've tried other documents and they open just fine.

I need this project, I can't start it over, I only have 2 or 3 days until it's due, and i'll be fired if I mess this up: It was the only chance he was giving me after another incident where I couldn't get a project done on time. [b:2vpjou7g]For the love of all that is good and holy, What can I do to recover this file?!?!?!?[/b:2vpjou7g]

Sincerely, Designer Jodan

Posts.EditableText: Open the asl file in a notepad and copy all the script. Then paste it in here under code brackets and I'll look at it, you could also email it to me, but I tend to pay less attention that way. Also, mention the last thing you edited before it started doing this.

Posts.EditableText:
Ok, well, I played the game(as much as possible, not much of it works and alot of commands aren't finished) to check the error messages quest was displaying. It was mostly having errors caused because of the piece of the variable [b:12nrjw1r]"Hawkarrousal"[/b:12nrjw1r]. I cut this section out of the asl file and tried to load it in QDK and it loaded up perfectly without the error.

So open up your asl file in notepad, back it up then select from the beginning of the line...

[b:12nrjw1r]define variable <Hawkarrousal>[/b:12nrjw1r]

to the end of the line...

[b:12nrjw1r]end define[/b:12nrjw1r]

delete that section of code, save the file, and attempt to open it with QDK once again. Should work fine.
Posts.HTML:
Ok, well, I played the game(as much as possible, not much of it works and alot of commands aren't finished) to check the error messages quest was displaying. It was mostly having errors caused because of the piece of the variable "Hawkarrousal". I cut this section out of the asl file and tried to load it in QDK and it loaded up perfectly without the error.

So open up your asl file in notepad, back it up then select from the beginning of the line...

define variable <Hawkarrousal>

to the end of the line...

end define

delete that section of code, save the file, and attempt to open it with QDK once again. Should work fine.

Posts.EditableText: Again, thanks the most holy amounts... but do I need to reprogram that ENTIRE variable?? Just curious, not lazy, this is for future reference.
Posts.HTML: Again, thanks the most holy amounts... but do I need to reprogram that ENTIRE variable?? Just curious, not lazy, this is for future reference.

from the manual, it seems for testing a variable you have to put it in between # # :

onchange if (%health% <= 0) then playerlose

maybe it can help

I'm not sure either it's a good idea to name a procedure :
define procedure <1>

You can also open your game with quest player, and read the error in the debug window

Posts.EditableText: It's very stange, I tried to isolate several parts of your variable and turn it so something very simple, but it still crashes. In comparision to other similar variable, it should work, so I guess other parts of your code are interfering with this variable so it makes it crash. I can't help you more, but by isolating all that is related to hawkarrousal you may find what is wrong, without reprograming all the variable. Btw if something else is wrong, as I expect, rewriting again the variable won't help, it may crash again.
